discussion.content: Given answer is correct. I feel you'd be more likely to see this question on the CCNA than the ENSLD though...
'1024' users maximum, means /22 is not enough (because it provides 1022 users except network address and broadcast address)

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A customer is planning to deploy a new branch in New York. The new office will not exceed 1024 users. Which subnet must be used to provide maximum number of host addresses while not providing more than necessary?

A company’s branch location uses redundant routers and links for connectivity to the headquarters. Also, to use the entire available bandwidth, the branch uses a dynamic routing protocol. An architect must design a multicast streaming solution to avoid RPF check failures because of the current network design. Which deployment model must the architect choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
i think is B

Selected Answer: D
D is the only one that makes sense

Selected Answer: D
i think its D as it sets its local preference to be more favourable

choices.C: Routers R3 and R10 advertise a lower local preference for outgoing traffic and a higher AS-PATH value for incoming traffic
choices.B: Router R6 influences the paths of R9 and R11 to the DC with a higher AS-PATH value
choices.A: Routers R3 and R10 advertise an IGP metric into BGP during redistribution in both directions
choices.D: Router R3 applies a local preference of 200 for R1, R2, R9, and R11 routers to reach the data center

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer working for a private service provider with an employee ID: 1234:56:789 must design a BGP solution based on:
• All traffic originating from AS100 must pass through AS200 to reach the NTP and DHCP server
• When a link failure occurs between R3 and R4, traffic must follow the R2-R9 link to reach the NTP and DHCP server

Which solution must the design include?

discussion.content: I used another /27 network. Why use this ones? What are the major issue which I don´t see?

comments.content: You should start subnetting bigger to smaller subnets. Using the other possible /27 you end up with overlapping subnets.
